dataList.name: Human Offering
dataList.subDesc: You see clay dolls in the distance.
dataList.desc:
They’re rummaging through corpses, looking for something.
Relentless demands for an offering ring in the ears.
They look like they might jump us at any second.

You see a dying person nearby, gasping for air.
Should you offer this person up?
Or…

options.messageDesc: All allies lose SP. Gain an E.G.O Gift.
result: Satisfied, the clay dolls carried the corpse-to-be off into the distance.

options.messageDesc: Begin a combat encounter. Win to gain a stronger E.G.O Gift.
result: Angered by your inaction, the clay dolls attacked you.

“Are your screws loose, Manager?”

The Sinners seem upset by your decision.

dataList.name: Human Offering
dataList.subDesc: You see clay dolls in the distance.
dataList.desc:
Looks like the Sinners are out of the question.

Should you offer up this dying person?
Or…

options.messageDesc: All allies lose SP. Gain an E.G.O Gift.
result: Satisfied, the clay dolls carried the corpse-to-be off into the distance.

options.messageDesc: Begin a combat encounter. Win to gain a stronger E.G.O Gift.
result: Angered by your inaction, the clay dolls attacked you.

dataList.name: Eternal Rest
dataList.desc:
You hear a faint voice.

"Help..."

Do you follow the voice? Or...

options.message: Check out the source of the voice.
options.messageDesc: Run a Pride check. Gain an E.G.O Gift.
result:
A soldier is crushed under rubble, gasping in agony.

"Please, just kill me... It hurts."

You can't ignore this person.
Who will be ordered to bring this soldier to pieace?

It could've been your senses playing tricks on you.
It's not uncommon for howling wind to be mistaken for human voice.

You decided to hurry along.

dataList.name: An Encounter with the Unbearable
dataList.subDesc: Crunching sounds jar on your nerves.
dataList.desc:
While traversing a narrow passage, a swarm of cockroaches crawled into the way.
The rustling visage is almost revolting.

Do you walk past them? Or...

options.message: Carefully walk past the gross swarm.
options.messageDesc: All allies lose SP
result:
"Eww... One got on my leg!"

Everyone managed to get through the passage, but their disgust is clearly visible.
They seem fatigued by the experience.

options.message: You've had enough. Crush the cockroaches with the Sinners.
options.messageDesc: Gregor loses a lot of SP. Begin a combat encounter. Win to gain an E.G.O Gift.
result:
"Tsk..."

Gregor turned away from the carnage, discontent.
Soon after, a crowd of angry bug-soldiers came charging at us.

dataList.name: Suspiciously Sparkly Vending Machine
dataList.desc:
In the middle of the factory, you find a vending machine with large buttons.

The buttons are colorful and fancy...
You feel a compulsion to press them.

What will you press?

options.message: Press the red button with a fist icon.
options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
"Congrats! Congrats!"

Something rumbled into the chute.

It appears to be a toy fist.

options.message: Press the yellow button with a foot icon.
options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
"Congrats! Congrats!"

Something rumbled into the chute.

It appears to be a toy foot.

options.message: Press the green button with a heart icon.
options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
"Congrats! Congrats!"

Something rumbled into the chute.

It appears to be a toy screw.

options.messageDesc: Gain 3 E.G.O Gifts. But...
result:
"Error! Error!"

The vending machine began to rattle.

"H-Hey, what's wrong with this thing?"

"Sigh, you should've known that it's not a good idea to get gr-"

Before the Sinner could finish, the machine exploded, spewing a slew of toy parts into the air.

You must resist odd impulses like this.
Meddling with the unknown is surely a bad idea.

You left the vending machine without touching anything on it.

dataList.name: Exhilarating Edutainment Featuring Excess Violence!
dataList.desc:
Exiting the passage, you see a group of cyborgs gathered around a huge roulette.

"Oh. Highly. Excited. Thoroughly. Amusing.
Da GAME of DEATH!"

They approach you, chanting in strange beats.
It looks like they want you to play a game of roulette. What should you do?

options.messageDesc: Rodya heals SP. Run Wrath, Sloth, and Gloom checks. Pass to heal SP of all allies and gain an E.G.O Gift.
result:
"You know this is where I shine!"

Rodya proudly proclaimed as she stepped forward.
You can see a mixture of anticipation and excitement on her face.

options.message: Forget games! Crush them in battle.
options.messageDesc: Rodya loses SP. Begin a combat encounter. Win to gain an E.G.O Gift.
result:
This isn't the time for games.
Let's deal with those crazed cyborgs and move on.

'...Psh'.

Rodya smacked her lips in dissatisfaction, but you know you can't afford to give every Sinner what they want.

dataList.name: Are You Happy?
dataList.desc:
A thick glass door stood at the pink frame.
The electronic display above suddenly flashed to life, showing a question.
"Are you happy?"
What will be your answer?

result:
"That's great!"

The display emitted a green flash, and the door opened for us.
Looks like we can get through.

dataList.name: Are You Happy? 2
dataList.desc:
"There is a pair of pink shoes that will take you to happiness."

The display glowed red.

"Would you like to try them on?"

options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
The glass door opened, revealing a pair of pink shoes.

When you put them on, you could feel strands of ribbons wrap around your legs.
They're tightening around your body, but it's not an unpleasant feeling.

You feel as though you can go...anywhere now.

options.messageDesc: Begin a combat encounter.
result:
'Don't shy away from the majesty of the pink shoes!'

The light over the shoes shut off when you backed off.

'They will take you wherever you want to go!'

The display began to flicker frantically,
and a group of people wrapped in pink ribbons shambled through the door.

dataList.name: An Old Room with a Clockwork Mechanism
dataList.desc:
There's a machine in the dilapidated room.
At the center of the machine adorned with springs is a long, bulky lever.
The urge, to pull, is growing, stronger and stronger.

What will you do?

options.messageDesc: 50% chance for a positive effect; 50% chance for a negative effect

result:
You're not a child, you can resist impulses like this.
It's not a good idea to fall for temptations without a second thought.

"Yeah, good thinking."

You and the Sinners left the room.

dataList.name: An Old Room with a Clockwork Mechanism
dataList.desc:
Putting a spontaneous thought to action is as impulsive and tempting as reaching for the marshmallow as a child.

When you pull down the lever, a clack follows soon after.
The springs begin to turn, some slow, some quick.
Some clockwise, others counter-clockwise.

Looking at the machine's rumble grow wilder, you feel an anxiety.

options.messageDesc: 50% chance to gain an E.G.O Gift. Failing results in HP and SP damage.
result:
The machine stopped at last.

"Huh... Look at that!"

A small wooden chest rose from the floor.
You carefully open it to find a bundle of torches.

It's not a lot, but they should give you a momentary relief in the dark.
You take the torches out of the room.

The machine stopped at last.

"W-What's happening to the room?!"

In the machine's stead, now the room began to tremble and crack.
A moment later, the ceiling split open, giving way for thousands of nails diving downward.

"Outside!"

"Dammit, I told you it's a bad idea to mess with it!"

You and the Sinners quickly evacuated the room, but not without harm.

dataList.name: Before a Sealed Door
dataList.desc:
A steel door rests on one side of the room.
It looks too thick to be broken or breached with force.

"There's gotta be something invaluable across here if it's guarded this tightly~!"

The Sinner might be right, a treasure might be waiting behind the door.
What should you do?

options.messageDesc: Run a Wrath check. Pass to open a new path on the map.
Run a Sloth check. Pass to open a new path on the map.

result:
It should be safer to take the known path rather than take unnecessary risks.

"Aww~ I swear something's gotta be in there!"

Though some Sinners complained, you persuaded them into letting it go.

dataList.name: The First Gate
dataList.desc:
You see a large gate in the distance.
There's something eerie about the pointy fences and stone walls.

That looks like the only way through this area, but it's guarded by a large number of inquisitors.
Is there anything we can do about it?

options.messageDesc: Run a Pride check, then begin a combat encounter. Pass to buff all allies and reduce number of waves by 1.
Run a Lust check, then begin a combat encounter. Pass to reduce the number of waves by 2.
Begin a 3-wave combat encounter.
result:
Sometimes, the simplest solution is the best one.
Separating a Sinner from the group in an attempt at a trick might end up putting us in disadvantage.

Let's face them head on.

dataList.name: A Room Full of Crates
dataList.desc:
Dozens of old, broken crates littered the floor.

"Ew, spiderwebs..."

Clearing them, you found three large crates buried underneath.

"These are all locked."

"Looks like the keyholes have the same shape!"

"...Alas, the key is of soft constitution. It won't be feasible to reuse it once it has been inserted into a lock."

It looks like you get only one try.
Which one should you open?

options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift that boosts defense.
result:
"This is..."

The crate contained a worn helm.

"Oho?! 'Tis the equipment of a knight, is it not?!"

One Sinner excitedly rubs the helm.
This wasn't a bad haul.
We took the helm (and the Sinner infatuated by it) and left the room.

options.messageDesc: 50% chance to gain an E.G.O Gift that boosts Tremor attacks.
result:
"This is..."

The crate contained an old mallet.
The cracks at the handle raised further questions about its usability.

"What are we supposed to do with this thing?"

The Sinners expressed disappointment over this seemingly regrettable choice.
But, you feel as if the mallet is talking to you,
compelling you to take it.

"What, you wanna take that with you?"

Though the Sinners saw it as junk,
I decided to bring the mallet.

"...Empty?"

There was nothing inside the crate.
All that greeted us were tiny specks of dirt stirred up by the exposure to the air outside.

"I told you we shoulda gone with that one~"

"No, it would have been empty in all likelihood."

You walked out of the room, trying to ignore the Sinners' complaints.

options.messageDesc: 50% chance to gain an E.G.O Gift that boosts Bleed attacks.
result:
"This is..."

The crate contained a rusty nail.
Not a bundle of nails; only one slightly large nail, covered in rust and dust.

"The heck..."

The Sinners looked devastated by the fact that the key was wasted on this.

"We can't just throw away loot. If you aren't gonna use it, hand it over."

One Sinner was showing interest in the item, so you gave it to them and went on your way.

"...Empty?"There was nothing inside the crate.

All that greeted us were tiny specks of dirt stirred up by the exposure to the air outside.

"I told you we shoulda gone with that one~"

"No, it would have been empty in all likelihood."

You walked out of the room, trying to ignore the Sinners' complaints.

dataList.name: Who Judges the Judge
dataList.desc:
The N Corp. inquisitors were busy torturing someone.

"GAAAAH!"

A filtered scream fills the cramped room. Their victims are people with prosthetic bodies.

'…….'

Sinclair didn't say a word, but his fearful and wrathful eyes were fixed on the torturers.
He breathed heavily at irregular intervals, his body shaking; he looked like he might charge forth any second.

Do you stop him?
Or...

options.message: Wait for the torture to end.
options.messageDesc: Certain Identities lose SP
result:
While the scene is horrible to behold, we are no valiant knights.
A wise manager wouldn't risk losing all Sinners over a juvenile impulse.
In that case...

"...Understood."

Sinclair gave you a vexed glare when you placed a hand on his shoulder, but he soon hung his head low and answered.
...Hopefully, this was the right call.
You decided to wait and watch until the torture is over.

options.messageDesc: Run a Wrath check, then begin a combat encounter. Use Sinclair for the check to gain 'A Sign'. Pass to weaken all enemies.
result:
We may not be valiant knights.
Even if we cast morals aside, however, we will have to fight them to move on.

"...Do you mean it?"

When you explain your plan to Sinclair, he looks back at you with surprise.

"I thought you would stop me..."

He speaks anxiously, but he seemed happy with my decision.

"Got it. I'll do it."

Sinclair sprinted to where the inquisitors are along with other Sinners.

dataList.name: A Rotting Corpse's Memento
dataList.desc:
"Geh, what't this odor..."

The Sinners frowned at the olfactory assault.
Following their eyes, you find an inquisitor collapsed on the floor.

"It's dead..."

The smell must be coming from the rotting corpse.
While everyone was hesitant to approach, you see something sparkle.

There seems to be something amidst the writhing manes...
What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Run a Gluttony check. Pass to gain an E.G.O Gift. Fail to lose HP and SP.

result:
It must be nothing.
If we really needed it, we could always recover it later.

You'd rather not damage the psyche of the Sinners for something uncertain.

dataList.name: [Hel. P. Me. He. Lp.]
dataList.desc:
You hear snappy mechanical noises through the closed door.

"Sounds like a cry for help..."

As you focus your attention, you begin to hear footsteps.

"Steel... Those are clangs of steel..."

Sinclair froze.
It looks like an inquisitor is coming for them.
What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Sinclair heals SP. Begin a combat encounter. Win to gain an E.G.O Gift.
result:
"...I knew I could count on you."

Sinclair jumped in as soon as you told him what to do.
As you expected, a number of prosthetic people were tied to a rope.

"You should run, quickly!"

As soon as Sinclair untied them, they hurriedly ran out of the room.

"Tch... Heretics!"

We were a little late to leave; the inquisitors shouted as they entered the room.
It seems conflict is unavoidable.

"...I knew I could count on you."

Sinclair jumped in as soon as you told him what to do.
As you expected, a number of prosthetic people were tied to a rope.

"You should run, quickly!"

As soon as Sinclair untied them, they hurriedly ran out of the room.

"Bastards, not even a simple 'thanks'."

Some Sinners complained,
but Sinclair looked satisfied with the deed.

Calming them down, we left the room.

options.messageDesc: Sinclair loses SP.
result:
"N-No... How could..."

Sinclair seems to be shocked by your answer.
As unfortunate as this is for him, losing Sinners while trying to save those people will be a fatal detriment in the coming fights.

[H, He. Help. H. Hel...]

We left in a hurry, leaving behind the cries.

dataList.name: Rite of Suppuration
dataList.desc:
The passage was heated red.

"Yeesh, that'd melt my shoes."

Sinners carefully approached the road, only to retreat from the overwhelming heat.
Something was written on the sign in front of the passage,

"Prove your humanity through weakness and suppuration.
Create a path with seared feet."

It took no time at all to figure out what this meant.
...What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Only available if the E.G.O Gift 'N Corp. Seal' is in possession.
result:
"We proved ourselves already, haven't we?"

A Sinner suggested.
It remined you that you owned a proof.

"Right... The seal!"

Tagging the seal on the sign caused the passage to cool down in an instant.
We were able to tread the path without a problem.

options.messageDesc: Run a Wrath check. Pass to gain an E.G.O Gift. Failing begins a 3-wave combat encounter.
50% chance for a 3-wave combat encounter.
result:
It seems too dangerous to make a Sinner cross this searing passage.
Not to mention, you don't know if there's anything to make the trip any easier for the rest even if one managed to cross it.
You figure you might be able to take another route as long as you're careful not to get spotted.

Unfortunately, a group of patrolling inquisitors noticed you.

It seems too dangerous to make a Sinner cross this searing passage.
Not to mention, you don't know if there's anything to make the trip any easier for the rest even if one managed to cross it.
You figure you might be able to take another route as long as you're careful not to get spotted.

Fortunately, you managed to get through without being noticed.

dataList.name: A Vessel of Zeal
dataList.desc:
You see a pedestal adorned with engravings of a nail and a hammer.

"Must be something to do with N Corp."

A Sinner mutters, and you agree.
Should you try to get some info on N Corp? Or...

options.message: Examine the book on the pedestal.
options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
Placed on the pedestal was the tome N Corp. inquisitors were often seen carrying.
You take this chance to peek at a few pages of it...

'Ugh...'

The indecipherable content only gave you a headache.
You decide to keep it for now and read it later.

options.message: Stay away from the noise and leave.
result:
We know enough already.
It's not worth snooping around suspicious areas.

dataList.name: Rite of Confrontation
dataList.desc:
A passage carved above the closed gate reads:

"Confront your fear and terror, and prove that you have feelings.

Fill this vessel with tears."

Looking around, you find the supposed vessel next to an unpleasant-looking chair.
What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Run a Gloom check. Selected Identitiy loses SP. Pass to gain an E.G.O Gift.

result:
It's too dangerous to attempt a rite when you aren't even sure how it might work.
We left the room.

dataList.name: Exhibit of Human Parts
dataList.desc:
You find a row of glass containers in a corner of the main area.
Inside them are dried organs and pieces of life showing active movement.

"A tragic display..."

The containers can be opened easily. You might take one of the pieces if you wanted to.
What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift that provides healing at low health.
result:
You took the glowing skull.
It radiates gently, and you feel a strange warmth from it.

The other containers won't open. It looks like you can take only one.
You took your leave with the item you got.

options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift that provides power-ups at low health.
result:
The bloody fingers caught your attention.
When you open the container to hold it, you notice that blood continues to drip from the section.
You took the perpetually flinching finger.

The other containers won't open. It looks like you can take only one.
You took your leave with the item you got.

options.messageDesc: Gain an E.G.O Gift that provides benefits after winning a clash
result:
The slithering tongue attracts your eyes.
When you open the container and grab it, it flaps in your palm.

You feel as though the tongue is mocking you, so you tried to pick another one, but...
The other containers won't open. It looks like you can take only one.
You took your leave with the item you got.

You decide not to take anything.
You'd rather not bother touching creepy organs.
Like that, we left the place.

dataList.name: Rite of Penance
dataList.desc:
A passage is written above the large gate.

"Pierce yourself with the thorns, and atone through suffering."

It looks like it wants us to impale ourselves on spikes.
What will you do?

options.messageDesc: Run a Wrath check. Selected Identitiy loses HP. Pass to gain an E.G.O Gift.

result:
There's simply too much risk involved.
You don't see a point in giving an order to jump into spikes.

We left the room.

dataList.name: The Final Rite
dataList.desc:
Hideously transformed N Corp. inquisitors stood guard at the gate.
You tried to attack, but they don't appear hostile in any capacity.

"Only. Exceptional...ones. Are allowed. In, this place."

"To...pass. You, will. Prove yourself. Worthy."

You aren't sure what they mean by proving yourself worthy.
What should you do?

options.message: Present the proof of passing the rites.
options.messageDesc: Only available if the E.G.O Gift 'N Corp. Seal' or all three Tokens of Innocence, Tears, and Atonement are in possession.
result:
You remembered that you've been collecting these tokens.
If those rites your group went through were tests, then the tokens must be the proof of your 'worth'.

"...You may, pass."

The inquisitors opened the gate, wailing in a bizarre voice.

"Take, this. With...you."

Receiving the item, we walked through the door.

options.messageDesc: Run a Lust check. Pass to proceed. Fail, and begin a difficult combat encounter.
Gain 'A Sign'. Begin a difficult combat encounter.
result:
It seems violence will be our most straightforward solution.

'...Heretic.'

The voice spilling out of that shaking jaw must be one of pure hostility.

'Allow me to help... Manager.'

Sinclair tightened the grip on his weapon, determination burning quietly in his eyes.

dataList.name: Inquisition
dataList.desc:
You met an N Corp. inquisitor.
Instead of attacking, they ask us if you loathe prosthetics.
What should you say?

result:
You agreed with the inquisitor.
They laughed and walked away.

You disagreed with the inquisitor.
Sinclair quietly nodded at you.
The angered inquisitor called in their subordinates.

You give the inquisitor a silent glare.
They lost interest in you and walked away.

dataList.name: Fanaticism
dataList.desc:
N Corp's inquisitors are torturing prosthetic people.
You see Sinclair tremble with fear and anger.
What will you do?

options.message: Wait for the torture to end.
result:
As painful as it is to watch, it might cause unnecessary conflict.
We should wait for them to finish.

We can't just sit back and watch, even if it means getting into a fight we could avoid.
Determined, Sinclair gripped his weapon.

dataList.name: Test of Worth
dataList.desc:
Strangely shaped inquisitors of N Corp. guard the gate.

'Only...those with worth...may enter.'

'To pass...you will show...your worth.'

What will you do?

options.message: Present the proof of passing the rites.
result:
You showed the inquisitors the tokens you got from those rituals.
They silently opened the door for us.
As we passed through, they gave you something.

All we can do is fight.
Let's handle this with violence.

dataList.name: 아즈텍원판 선택지1
dataList.desc:
There are many ways to calm one down,
but this Abnormality seems to like gifts the most.
A fresh batch of blood might be able to appease it.

result:
You gave a living clay doll as tribute.
Satiated, the Abnormality calmed down for a moment.

dataList.name: 아즈텍원판 선택지3
dataList.desc:
To weaken the flame, you'll need cool water.
Since we aren't carrying any buckets of water, we should offer up someone cool instead.

result:
You gave a living clay doll as tribute.
The flame shrunk to a flicker.

dataList.name: 아즈텍원판 선택지5
dataList.desc:
The starts are twinkling.
When they shine, they'll rob us all of our sight.
What gift would the stars like?

dataList.name: 강화인간 선택지1
dataList.desc:
How do those cyborgs keep coming back?
The Sinners were discussing.

"Perhapse those beings are not alive.
That way, they would not be able to die."

"No, we're not getting philosophical here."

"Hmm~ To me, it looked like rebuiling a brick wall."

"...I think I'm hearing something from that factory in the back."

The group turned their gaze to the factory behind the cyborgs.
Clanks of steel could be heard from the place that was quiet until moments ago.

Maybe you should take a look at that shady facility?

result:
You decided to check out the factory.
But, you might want to do something about the cyborgs first just to be safe.

Perhaps you could earn enough time to get through by incapacitating the biggest one?

options.message: We can't walk into danger like that. Keep fighting them.
result:
"Do we really have to crawl into a place like that?"

One Sinner spoke bluntly.
That's a good point. No need to take risks.

If they keep coming back, we'll just keep beating them until they don't.

dataList.name: 강화인간 선택지2
dataList.desc:
Pinning the largest cyborg down as planned, you got to the factory in time.

"Huh, this is..."

"Looks like some kind of toy factory."

The Sinners comment on the huge mechanism.

"Ah! Come behold this curiosity!"

The Sinner pointed to a control panel with several buttons attached to it.

<DO YOU LOVE THE CITY YOU LIVE IN?>

What should you press?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to proceed.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to stop.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

Detected three inputs.
Operating emergency protocol 3: facility shutdown.

"Looks like it's stopped."

The machines whirred for a short while before stopping.
With that, the cyborgs should no longer revive.
Let's step outside the factory, shall we?

dataList.name: 강화인간 선택지2-그렇다
dataList.desc:
Continuing the augmentation.

You
must
become
strong.

Please proceed with the input.

<DO YOU LOVE THE CITY YOU LIVE IN?>

What should you press?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to proceed.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to stop.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

Detected three inputs.
Operating emergency protocol 3: facility shutdown.

"Looks like it's stopped."

The machines whirred for a short while before stopping.
With that, the cyborgs should no longer revive.
Let's step outside the factory, shall we?

dataList.name: 강화인간 선택지2-아니다
dataList.desc:
Incorrect input.

You
must
become
strong.

Please input your answer again.

WARNING: Pressing the button three times will cause the facility to shut down.

<DO YOU LOVE THE CITY YOU LIVE IN?>

What should you press?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to proceed.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

options.messageDesc: Press the button to stop.
result:
Abnormal input.

"Huh? I can't press any of these..."

Commencing site burial in 3, 2...

"Outta here!!"

After a short notice, the factory exploded with a massive bang.
You managed to stop it from working, but the Sinners were caught up in the explosion as well.

Looks like you should get out of here first, don't you think?

Detected three inputs.
Operating emergency protocol 3: facility shutdown.

"Looks like it's stopped."

The machines whirred for a short while before stopping.
With that, the cyborgs should no longer revive.
Let's step outside the factory, shall we?

dataList.name: 분홍신 선택지1
dataList.desc:
A voice travels between the fluttering ribbons.

"What is your desire?"

"Put on me."

"I'll take you wherever you want to go."

The suggestions are incredibly suspicious, but for some reason, the Sinners are struggling to decide what to do.

What do you say?

result:
"Yeah... This is good."

"It's all smooth."

The Sinners expressed their fascination.
Those ribbons had turned into shiny pairs of pink shoes.

Now, everyone will be able to go where they want.

Probably.

dataList.name: Vending Machine and Oceanic Waves
dataList.desc:
You see an empty lot ahead where the Sinners can take rest.

There, you find a vending machine with a number of buttons on it.
You see drinks as well, but you can't recognize what they're supposed to depict.
What will you do?

options.message: No need to take risks. Just rest here with the Sinners.
result:
Some time passed.

Thanks to the respite,
the group seems well-rested.

options.message: Get some drinks they might like, as a treat.
result:
운이 좋게도,
골라갔던 음료가 모두의 입에 맞은 모양이다.

쉬고 일어난 수감자들의 모습에 활력이 넘치는 것 같다.
아무래도 괴상한 음료를 뽑은 것 같다.
표정을 잔뜩 구기면서 저마다 음료를 내뱉거나 하고 있다. 
쉬고 일어난 수감자들의 모습도 무언가 찌뿌둥해보인다. 
탈이라도 안나서 다행이야...
